description: Lightweight sandals made from wound cord.  They offer little in the way of protection, but keep you cool during warmer months.
Tough leather boots, for tough everyday work.
Leather boots covered with tiny, finely-carved bones.  With each step, the bones collide with each other producing a melodic clicking.
A pair of steel-toed rubber boots, the sort worn by firefighters.
Boots made from the exoskeletons of insects.
Boots crafted from carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.

name.str_pl: pairs of XL biosilicified chitin boots

name.str: pair of XS biosilicified chitin boots
name.str_pl: pairs of XS biosilicified chitin boots

description: Modern reinforced tactical combat boots.  Very durable.
Armored foot protectors constructed from steel and Nomex for use by explosive ordnance disposal technicians.
Rubbery overshoes that cover your toes with sturdy, OSHA compliant steel toes.
Boots lined with fur for warmth.
Tough yet light leather boots, intended for outdoor activity.
Thick leather boots made specifically to protect the feet.  Light yet tough.

name.str: pair of XL leather armor boots
name.str_pl: pairs of XL leather armor boots

name.str: pair of XS leather armor boots
name.str_pl: pairs of XS leather armor boots

description: An extremely heavy set of armor plated boots.
A pair of rubber boots, often used while cleaning with caustic materials.
Boots made of random scraps attached to simple cloth wraps.  Uncomfortable, but decent protection.
Leather boots with a steel toe, intended for use by workers.
A descendant of the classic steeltoed boot, this modern footwear has become popular amongst working class people over the last couple of decades.
Stiff leather boots with intricate embroidery and one-inch heels.  These may look good, but these boots are made for walking.  Each boot is large enough to conceal a small holdout pistol.
Wool-lined boots designed for warmth.
Sport shoes with hard undersides, and studs on the bottom designed to dig into the grass.
Snug fit sport shoes with hard ridges on the bottom.
Known as klompen in the Netherlands and sabots in France, these wooden shoes have endured through the ages due to their simple design and durability.
Gigantic shoes fit for a clown.  Incredibly difficult to walk in.
Expensive black dance shoes with large heels.
Fancy patent leather shoes.  Not designed for running in.
Simple sandals.  Somewhat difficult to run in.
These are upmarket "luxury" flip-flops.  Very difficult to run in.
Rags tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, still better than nothing.
Fur pelts tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, still better than nothing.
Leather patches tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, still better than nothing.
Felt patches tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, still better than nothing.
Simple wooden geta.
A pair of high heels.  Difficult to even walk in.
Very long leather boots that cover the lower legs, these are difficult to wear.
Custom made knee-high leather boots issued to motor officers.  Warm, durable and quite tough.
Sturdy leather hiking sandals with a heel strap.  Offers little in the way of protection, but keeps you cool during warmer months.
Lightweight shoes made of cloth and rubber.
Simple shoes made from animal pelts.
A pair of durable boots to be used by dirt bikers and motorcyclists.
A pair of inline skates.  Very fast on flat floors, but they make it hard to move on rough terrain, take hits, or to dodge effectively.
An old-fashioned pair of leather rollerskates with steel frames.  While quite fast on flat floors, they make it difficult to take hits or to move on rough terrain.
Simple shoes woven from strips of birch bark.  Not very comfortable, but better than going barefoot.
A pair of flat-soled shoes designed to give you a grip on slippery surfaces.
Soft shoes that keep your feet warm.  Not suitable for running.
Guaranteed to make you run faster and jump higher!
Sandals made from straw rope.  Not very comfortable, but can keep your feet safe.
A pair of rubber flippers worn on the feet which improve swimming speed while greatly impeding the wearer's ability to walk.
Very long leather boots that reach past the knees, these are difficult to wear.
A pair of neoprene swimming booties, with individual toes.
A pair of thick neoprene swimming booties, with individual toes.
A pair of sneakers with wheels, currently the wheels are hidden.
A pair of sneakers with wheels, currently the wheels are out.

use_action.msg: You pop the wheels back in.

description: A snug-fitting pair of stockings made from thin and lightweight Nomex fabric.
A snug-fitting pair of stockings made from thin and lightweight Nomex fabric.
A snug-fitting pair of stockings made from thin and lightweight Nomex fabric.
Socks.  Put 'em on your feet.
Socks.  Big ones.  Put 'em on your feet.
Socks.  Put 'em on your feet.
Short socks, commonly used for sports.  These are designed to protect your feet from friction, not temperature.
A pair of disposable plastic bags, adapted to be used as socks.
Cheap one time socks.  Can keep your feet clean, but too thin to give any protection.
Warm socks made of wool.
Warm socks made of wool for a human larger than previously thought possible.
Warm socks made of wool for a human smaller than previously thought possible.
Long cotton socks that reach above the knees to help protect from the cold.
Six long cotton tubes sized to fit over tentacles and help protect them from the cold.
A pair of black tabi, as worn with traditional Japanese clothes.
A pair of white tabi, as used by martial arts practitioners.
A leather boot with jointed plates for protection.
